# Modelling Geographical Accessibility

## 1 Getting Started

### 1.1 Load and Install R Packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tmap, SpatialAcc, sf, 
               ggstatsplot, reshape2,
               tidyverse)
```
:::


## 2 Geospatial Data Wrangling

### 2.1 Importing Geospatial Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\brigittatsai\ISSS626_AY2024-25_T1\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex09\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagons <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "hexagons") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `hexagons' from data source 
  `C:\brigittatsai\ISSS626_AY2024-25_T1\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex09\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 3125 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 21506.33 xmax: 50010.26 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
eldercare <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "ELDERCARE")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `ELDERCARE' from data source 
  `C:\brigittatsai\ISSS626_AY2024-25_T1\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex09\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 120 features and 19 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 14481.92 ymin: 28218.43 xmax: 41665.14 ymax: 46804.9
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
```


:::
:::


### 2.2 Updating CRS Information


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_transform(mpsz, 3414)
eldercare <- st_transform(eldercare, 3414)
hexagons <- st_transform(hexagons, 3414)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21 / Singapore TM",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21",
        DATUM["SVY21",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        ID["EPSG",4757]],
    CONVERSION["Singapore Transverse Mercator",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["northing (N)",north,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
        AXIS["easting (E)",east,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
    USAGE[
        SCOPE["Cadastre, engineering survey, topographic mapping."],
        AREA["Singapore - onshore and offshore."],
        BBOX[1.13,103.59,1.47,104.07]],
    ID["EPSG",3414]]
```


:::
:::


### 2.3 Cleaning and Updating Attribute Fields of Geospatial Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
eldercare <- eldercare %>%
  select(fid, ADDRESSPOS) %>%
  mutate(capacity = 100)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagons <- hexagons %>%
  select(fid) %>%
  mutate(demand = 100)
```
:::


## 3 Aspatial Data Wrangling

### 3.1 Importing Distance Matrix


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ODMatrix <- read_csv("data/aspatial/OD_Matrix.csv", skip = 0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 375000 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
dbl (6): origin_id, destination_id, entry_cost, network_cost, exit_cost, tot...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::


### 3.2 Tidying Distance Matrix

The code below is used to transform the O-D matrix from thin to fat format


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
distmat <- ODMatrix %>%
  select(origin_id, destination_id, total_cost) %>%
  spread(destination_id, total_cost)%>%
  select(c(-c('origin_id')))
```
:::


Convert metre to kilometre


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
distmat_km <- as.matrix(distmat/1000)
```
:::


## 4 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using Hansen Method

### 4.1 Computing Hansen's Accessibility


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            #d0 = 50,
                            power = 2, 
                            family = "Hansen"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
colnames(acc_Hansen) <- "accHansen"
```
:::


Convert data table into tibble format


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- tbl_df(acc_Hansen)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: `tbl_df()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.0.0.
ℹ Please use `tibble::as_tibble()` instead.
```


:::
:::


Join acc_Hansen tibble dataframe with the hexagons sf dataframe


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_Hansen <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_Hansen)
```
:::


hexagon_Hansen is a sf dataframe and not a typical tibble dataframe. We can use the code below to perform using a single code chunk


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            #d0 = 50,
                            power = 0.5, 
                            family = "Hansen"))

colnames(acc_Hansen) <- "accHansen"
acc_Hansen <- tbl_df(acc_Hansen)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: `tbl_df()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.0.0.
ℹ Please use `tibble::as_tibble()` instead.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_Hansen <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_Hansen)
```
:::


### 4.2 Visualising Hansen's Accessibility

#### 4.2.1 Extracting Map Extend


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mapex <- st_bbox(hexagons)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hexagon_Hansen,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accHansen",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: Hansen method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 2,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 6),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 4.3 Statistical Graphic Visualisation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_Hansen <- st_join(hexagon_Hansen, mpsz, 
                          join = st_intersects)
```
:::


Plot distribution by using boxplot graphical method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_Hansen, 
       aes(y = log(accHansen), 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in geom_point(stat = "summary", fun.y = "mean", colour = "red", :
Ignoring unknown parameters: `fun.y`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 5 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using KD2SFCA Method

### 5.1 Computing KD2SFCA's Accessibility


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_KD2SFCA <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            d0 = 50,
                            power = 2, 
                            family = "KD2SFCA"))

colnames(acc_KD2SFCA) <- "accKD2SFCA"
acc_KD2SFCA <- tbl_df(acc_KD2SFCA)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: `tbl_df()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.0.0.
ℹ Please use `tibble::as_tibble()` instead.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_KD2SFCA <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_KD2SFCA)
```
:::


### 5.2 Visualising KD2SFCA's Accessibility


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hexagon_KD2SFCA,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accKD2SFCA",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: KD2SFCA method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 6),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 5.3 Statistical Graphic Visualisation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_KD2SFCA <- st_join(hexagon_KD2SFCA, mpsz, 
                          join = st_intersects)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_KD2SFCA, 
       aes(y = accKD2SFCA, 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in geom_point(stat = "summary", fun.y = "mean", colour = "red", :
Ignoring unknown parameters: `fun.y`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 6 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using Spatial Accessibility Measure (SAM) Method

### 6.1 Computing SAM Accessibility


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_SAM <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                         eldercare$capacity,
                         distmat_km, 
                         d0 = 50,
                         power = 2, 
                         family = "SAM"))

colnames(acc_SAM) <- "accSAM"
acc_SAM <- tbl_df(acc_SAM)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: `tbl_df()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.0.0.
ℹ Please use `tibble::as_tibble()` instead.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_SAM <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_SAM)
```
:::


### 6.2 Visualising SAM's Accessibility


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hexagon_SAM,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accSAM",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: SAM method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 2,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 3),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 6.3 Statistical Graphic Visualisation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_SAM <- st_join(hexagon_SAM, mpsz, 
                       join = st_intersects)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_SAM, 
       aes(y = accSAM, 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in geom_point(stat = "summary", fun.y = "mean", colour = "red", :
Ignoring unknown parameters: `fun.y`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex09_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
